ticket.title: Rails template should allow to specify framework parts
ticket.original-body:
Rails template should allow to specify without which parts generate application. For example. I don't want to use ActiveRecord so I could write in template without_framework :active_record
And in app generated with such a template in config/environment.rb I will have config.frameworks -= [ :active_record ]
I tried to do some workaround for it but I can't find Rails::TemplateRunner class in rails master git repo.

version.title: Rails template should allow to specify framework parts

version.body:
Support of modifying environment.rb with rails templates *commands* is *iirc* limited to add "config.gem" options with gem(),
But of course you can put any ruby code in your template file to read+change+write the environment.rb file or do what you like. (or use run() and any console command)
good sources:
http://m.onkey.org/2008/12/4/rails-templates http://github.com/ffmike/BigOldRailsTemplate
